page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY..KILMARON
page.content: This once splendid house was built in 1794 to 1795 by Admiral Maitland, one of Nelson's commanders. Prize money was probably used to finance its construction. Designed in the Gothic revival style by the architect, Gillespie Graham, the building unfortunately had built-in design defects which meant dry rot became a chronically serious problem. The owners of the house finally decided it was uninhabitable and it was demolished in 1983. The estate land around the old house site remains much as it was in the 19th century, with distinctive open parkland and mature trees. The attractive woodland on the slopes to the North of the ruined house adds to the quality of this estate and though the house at Kilmaron Castle is no longer with us, we hope the estate is maintained.
